review_title: My experience so far at PCCI.
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Austin, TX
pros: Working remote is a big factor in my life at the moment and I appreciate the option to do so The work is very collaborative and learning environment is highly encouraged.
cons: The only down side is the limited face time with colleagues.

pros: Very diverse and collaborative team. Everyone is willing to help others. Leadership listens and seeks input from team members often. Employee engagement team is active and hosts lots of fun activities for the team. New tools added to help streamline work and be more organized and efficient. Transparency into all projects and pipeline of projects.
cons: Can't think of any at this time.

review_title: Innovative Company for both Patients and Employees
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Dallas, TX
pros:
Focus driven regarding patients.
Takes care of their employees.
Have fun while working very hard.
Give back to the community every chance they get.
cons:
Too many meetings which sometimes can be overwhelming.
Short staffed, need people on board.

pros: PCCI offers the best work-life balance. These days that’s very important to many employees. Autonomy is fostered here! Diversity and inclusion are valued here.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of.

pros: Overall great company to work for.
cons: Lack of communication in specific circumstances.

pros: I'm excited to go to work daily.  I'm willing and excited to come in early and stay as late as needed.  At the point in my life the environment is key. I'm surrounded by brilliant people, that are creative, innovative and yes collaborative. I'm constantly busy doing something. I don't have time to be bored. Overall I feel appreciated, I go over and beyond first because that's who I am, but its important that I give PCCI 110%. I love my Director, she is not micro managing.  She appreciates my contributions and she is very good at acknowledging that. I feel she wants me to succeed in my role. That means the world to me. I feel I have a open door policy with her.  My CEO ,I simply adore! He's management style is absolutely incredible.  He's warm, caring and very relatable. He delivery is genuine.  He is meticulous, places importance on details. He is very observant.  He makes you want to work with him and for him.  I am so proud and blessed to be here.
cons: There are a few challenges and very small concerns. I am confidant that in my tenure these needs will be addressed.

pros:
- get on leadership’s good side and you will be at least a vp in no time
- good benefits and there are good snacks sometimes
- work with some smart people on potentially impactful projects
- big focus on employee engagement but feedback is mostly ignored (exception snacks) 
- new chief funding and innovation officer - experienced enough to implement an actual strategy
- great place to work if you are very agreeable
- If you are agreeable you will get paid a lot 
- good place to learn how to handle office politics
cons:
- toxic leadership besides CEO. However, CEO strongly influenced by toxic leadership
- Unfortunate operations - company of this size does not need a COO. especially not one that is very disconnected from the work, is inexperienced, and is a backstabber out for their own agenda
- unclear career path and little support.
- NOTHING told to anyone is confidential 
- 8/35 people are are VP level or above
- high turnover. Leadership ignores the real reason people have left. 
- No one takes responsibility. Fault is always on someone else.

review_title: PCCI is doing great things for all.
pros: Great CEO who is doing everything in his power to understand, and fulfill PCCI's mission. HR and management are working together to recruit employees who are highly qualified and are ready to make impact in our communities.  Management is concerned with making PCCI a great place to work at. They  have taken the time to truly listen to employees and have put in the work to make positive changes for PCCI.
cons: Need to focus more on getting to know the stories of the communities we serve on an individual employee basis.

pros: Being a researcher, innovation is what drives you and it exactly happens here. The work environment is very congenial. The people have great work ethic and very lively to work along. Ideas and implementation is just exceptional under a caring and focussed leadership.
cons: Just started to work here and nothing much to say. Except not many restaurants around for good food.

pros: Mission to help communities achieve  better health through innovative projects and research makes for an inspiring work place environment
cons: Work requires collaboration across organization walls that requires care and watering to maintain good channels of communication and to maintain alignment

review_title: An exciting innovative place to work
job_title: Senior Medical Director in Dallas, TX
pros:
Work with mission driven, passionate, highly skilled and professional colleagues from a variety of cutting edge fields in analytics and health care.
Has a well developed and effective innovation cycle and project management strategy.  Company is in  an exciting growth phase.
cons: Needs room to grow, running out of office space.

pros:
Great engagement team
Teamwork 
Community service strong
Flexibility 
Remote work twice a month
cons: Parking in our parking area is a huge challenge daily!!!

pros: friendly team members, smooth interviewing and on-boarding process.
The information exchange portal project can make a real difference in community health
cons: Management treats employees badly. Poor compensation. Poor work life balance. Not a mission-driven non-profit.
